intro: Tetradenia falafa, commonly known as the African wild bean, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, simple leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, bean-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in dry woodlands and savannas, thriving in well-drained soils. Tetradenia falafa is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
